summary:
RS: She obviously has family on her mind in this episode. But when 
she tells Gendry “I can be your family,” it sounds like she...
caption:
RS: She obviously has family on her mind in this episode. But when she tells Gendry “I can be your family,” it sounds like she might mean something very different – even if she herself barely realizes it yet.

When I first read that scene, it really got to me. I always knew that Arya and Gendry were going to take separate paths, but when you actually see it… I was really getting on well with Joe [Dempsie], and it was just like “Oh, this is going to end now.” Then you go in do it. At first I read it as “You can come to Winterfell, I’ll show you how everything goes, and you can come and sit at the table with us.” I thought it would be a bit like Theon. But when I was doing the scene, [director] Alex Graves said “When you say that last line, ‘I can be your family,’ say it like ‘I love you.‘” And that’s the take that they used. On the day, we didn’t cut in between. We kept going, and going, and going again, which I really liked; otherwise, you get out of it and you have to try and build yourself back up to that point again. Sometimes I was really crying, and then we’d pull it back. I don’t know how many we did, but the last one we did…We settled on the one when I said it like “I love you,” and it really works. - Maisie Williams, Rolling Stone magazine 2013 [x]

reblog.comment:

summary: “Sansa prays quietly, but Arya …" He hesitated. "She has not said a word since they brought you back. She is a fierce little...
caption: “Sansa prays quietly, but Arya …" He hesitated. “She has not said a word since they brought you back. She is a fierce little thing, my lord. I have never seen such anger in a girl.”

summary: On my mind.
title: On my mind.
description:
by xxitisbluexx

En las noches posteriores a su resurrección, él trata de darle un rostro a esa hermana suya por la que entregó su vida; intenta rescatar algún recuerdo de su infancia que justifique el romper sus votos.

Jon no puede.

blog.description:

ASoIaF Fan. Bran Stark defense squad. Breera shipper. Gendrya shipper.

Mother of Puppies.

summary: Arya
question: Arya
answer:
Okay, I think about Arya’s faith all the time.

For the past few months — basically ever since season 7 ended — I’ve been pretty confident that all the remaining Starklings will survive.

By now, I get less and less confident with each day. My biggest concern is Arya. In season 7 she seemed to take too much pride in her skills and training. She might get herself in too much trouble too many times.

I am aware that this is very Hollywood cliche BUT I think she will die protecting her family. And by family I mean Sansa. Arya and her sister have never been close but I believe they will learn to trust and rely on each other in season 8. Especially with the new thread — and I’m not talking White Walkers but a certain someone from the south. Both Stark sisters went through hell and came back home; stronger than anyone would’ve ever imagined.

Arya dying for her sister would show her growth and underline the fact that family has always been her number one priority — even when she gave up her identity she could never truly let go of them.


But let’s get to the positive things.

Arya will finish her list. She won’t kill Cersei, but The Hound, the last name on her list, will be her claim.

Jonrya Reunion. Do I need to say more? But, hate to be THAT person, thinking about Dany I see some major issues between them. Arya won’t trust Dany, Jon would like her to. This will be very very VERY interesting.

GENDRYA REUNION. Guys, I can’t breathe it’s gonna happen. IT’S GONNA HAPPEN.

summary: The Warning & The Hostage
title: The Warning & The Hostage
body:
What if Series by d_aia 

The Warning 

Chapter: 1/1

Summary: 

What if Arya, after leaving the Hound and knowing she doesn’t have the money to buy herself passage to Jon, goes to the Red Keep hoping to see Sansa? Unfortunately, Sansa has already left but Arya has heard about the trial by combat between the Mountain and Oberyn Martell. She stays to watch. What would change?


The Hostage 

Chapter: 1/1

Summary: 

What if Robb has an idea regarding the Freys and meeting Talisa doesn’t end up being that momentous? How would Tywin react? What would change?

summary: “That’s not me.” One of Arya’s well known lines. This conversation with her dad is of course important. When he tells her what...
body: “That’s not me.” One of Arya’s well known lines. This conversation with her dad is of course important. When he tells her what would be expected of her she knows at the time she wants to be different, and just by the look of Ned’s face, he knows too.

reblog.comment: “That’s not me.” One of Arya’s well known lines. This conversation with her dad is of course important. When he tells her what would be expected of her she knows at the time she wants to be different, and just by the look of Ned’s face, he knows too.

tags: you can't let him be happy for once
summary: Jon is almost alone
title: Jon is almost alone
body:
Hey Tumblr a few minutes ago (it will be half an hour after I finish this papyrus) I read a post made by jackoshadows that made me think. In the GOT series jon is almost always alone, few support him in his desperate attempt to save the human species.
Jon on the show, as well as in the books, is a bit of a maliconic person, which derives from his being a bastard in the eyes of Westeros society and its beliefs deriving from it, and therefore he grew up trying to wash this shame that he has in everyone’s eyes .

 Arriving at this eighth season I saw a very sad thing from the GOT Fandom, the treatment that Jon is undergoing for choosing to be with Daenarys, as I said in my last post Jon is one of the few poor assholes he is trying to save westeros and for this Jon is almost completely alone, the only characters that have always supported him in his choices are Davos Tormund and Edd for the rest Jon is always alone and under attack:

The Nightwatch brothers who first elect him as Lord commander and then stab him because they do not accept that peace with Freefolk is necessary to resist the Others ;                                                                                                             The lords of the north who would let Ramsey kill him and his sister and who then after a hard battle in which they did nothing acclaim him king are immediately ready to conspire behind him ;                                                            His sister Sansa, who after persuading him to fight against the Boltons and making him lose almost 2/3 of his troops (and the freefolk sincerely are one of the few groups who believe in Jon) is immediately ready to accuse him of giving away their home a foreign queen (because you know in feudalism if you swear loyalty to someone you also give your lands/S) even if that “foreign queen” is the only one with an army that has the slightest hope of stopping the apocalypse;      And finally, and I sincerely hope the leaks are fake, even Sam and Arya, two of the people Jon loves most in the world are ready to line up against him for theyr own interest (and puttana Eva if D and D devastate the relationship between Jon and Arya I will be pissed off) . 

I say it clearly I am not a  fan of Daenarys or a Jonerys (im not a big shipper on Got), her character made mistakes that cost lives but she is not a monster , in the books she’s only a child/teen how’s trying to change an horrible society and in the shows they change some of her more questionable action ,but one thing that I appreciated Jonerys  as a Jon fan is the fact that for once Jon was able to choose to be happy with a person who loves him as he is and I have to say that Jon fought “alone” for so long that I can only be happy that he is finally with someone who supports him.

So when I read all these posts that attack Jon, I can only think of one thing, and excuse the French, but what other character worked and sacrificed so much to prepare the world for the apocalypse.

P.S. Before anyone comes to tell me again “and but Jon was going to abandon the NW after they stabbed him” I just want to answer, after he died and resurrected, with relative discovery that after death there is nothing but somehow the God who lovingly burns children exists, it kind deserves a couple of days of emotional mess

Hey Tumblr a few minutes ago (it will be half an hour after I finish this papyrus) I read a post made by jackoshadows that made me think. In the GOT series jon is almost always alone, few support him in his desperate attempt to save the human species.
Jon on the show, as well as in the books, is a bit of a maliconic person, which derives from his being a bastard in the eyes of Westeros society and its beliefs deriving from it, and therefore he grew up trying to wash this shame that he has in everyone’s eyes .

 Arriving at this eighth season I saw a very sad thing from the GOT Fandom, the treatment that Jon is undergoing for choosing to be with Daenarys, as I said in my last post Jon is one of the few poor assholes he is trying to save westeros and for this Jon is almost completely alone, the only characters that have always supported him in his choices are Davos Tormund and Edd for the rest Jon is always alone and under attack:

The Nightwatch brothers who first elect him as Lord commander and then stab him because they do not accept that peace with Freefolk is necessary to resist the Others ;                                                                                                             The lords of the north who would let Ramsey kill him and his sister and who then after a hard battle in which they did nothing acclaim him king are immediately ready to conspire behind him ;                                                            His sister Sansa, who after persuading him to fight against the Boltons and making him lose almost 2/3 of his troops (and the freefolk sincerely are one of the few groups who believe in Jon) is immediately ready to accuse him of giving away their home a foreign queen (because you know in feudalism if you swear loyalty to someone you also give your lands/S) even if that “foreign queen” is the only one with an army that has the slightest hope of stopping the apocalypse;      And finally, and I sincerely hope the leaks are fake, even Sam and Arya, two of the people Jon loves most in the world are ready to line up against him for theyr own interest (and puttana Eva if D and D devastate the relationship between Jon and Arya I will be pissed off) . 

I say it clearly I am not a  fan of Daenarys or a Jonerys (im not a big shipper on Got), her character made mistakes that cost lives but she is not a monster , in the books she’s only a child/teen how’s trying to change an horrible society and in the shows they change some of her more questionable action ,but one thing that I appreciated Jonerys  as a Jon fan is the fact that for once Jon was able to choose to be happy with a person who loves him as he is and I have to say that Jon fought “alone” for so long that I can only be happy that he is finally with someone who supports him.

So when I read all these posts that attack Jon, I can only think of one thing, and excuse the French, but what other character worked and sacrificed so much to prepare the world for the apocalypse.

P.S. Before anyone comes to tell me again “and but Jon was going to abandon the NW after they stabbed him” I just want to answer, after he died and resurrected, with relative discovery that after death there is nothing but somehow the God who lovingly burns children exists, it kind deserves a couple of days of emotional mess
trail.content:

 Arriving at this eighth season I saw a very sad thing from the GOT Fandom, the treatment that Jon is undergoing for choosing to be with Daenarys, as I said in my last post Jon is one of the few poor assholes he is trying to save westeros and for this Jon is almost completely alone, the only characters that have always supported him in his choices are Davos Tormund and Edd for the rest Jon is always alone and under attack:

The Nightwatch brothers who first elect him as Lord commander and then stab him because they do not accept that peace with Freefolk is necessary to resist the Others ;                                                                                                             The lords of the north who would let Ramsey kill him and his sister and who then after a hard battle in which they did nothing acclaim him king are immediately ready to conspire behind him ;                                                            His sister Sansa, who after persuading him to fight against the Boltons and making him lose almost 2/3 of his troops (and the freefolk sincerely are one of the few groups who believe in Jon) is immediately ready to accuse him of giving away their home a foreign queen (because you know in feudalism if you swear loyalty to someone you also give your lands/S) even if that “foreign queen” is the only one with an army that has the slightest hope of stopping the apocalypse;      And finally, and I sincerely hope the leaks are fake, even Sam and Arya, two of the people Jon loves most in the world are ready to line up against him for theyr own interest (and puttana Eva if D and D devastate the relationship between Jon and Arya I will be pissed off) . 

I say it clearly I am not a  fan of Daenarys or a Jonerys (im not a big shipper on Got), her character made mistakes that cost lives but she is not a monster , in the books she’s only a child/teen how’s trying to change an horrible society and in the shows they change some of her more questionable action ,but one thing that I appreciated Jonerys  as a Jon fan is the fact that for once Jon was able to choose to be happy with a person who loves him as he is and I have to say that Jon fought “alone” for so long that I can only be happy that he is finally with someone who supports him.

Before anyone comes to tell me again “and but Jon was going to abandon the NW after they stabbed him” I just want to answer, after he died and resurrected, with relative discovery that after death there is nothing but somehow the God who lovingly burns children exists, it kind deserves a couple of days of emotional mess

summary: Oh lord !!! I’ve never expected such a warm welcome from Gendrya (and sibling Jonrya) fandom. I’m forever thankful for the...
caption: Oh lord !!! I’ve never expected such a warm welcome from Gendrya (and sibling Jonrya) fandom. I’m forever thankful for the support from all and waiting for those reunions as much as every single one of you. Don’t worry, only a few days left and I’m sure we’ll be satisfied with even the slightest interaction. Although have to say that I count on warm embraces in both cases, so this Gendrya  “I’m glad you are not dead, bullhead.” “Likewise, M’lady.”  hug is for you and I hope it’ll brighten your day. Spreading love  xoxo

tags: the show messed them so much
he would never hurt her in the books
summary:
Arya: You're like a shark.
Jaqen: That kind of hurts my feelings a little bit. I'm actually a pretty sensitive guy.
Arya: Oh,...
body:
Arya: You're like a shark.
Jaqen: That kind of hurts my feelings a little bit. I'm actually a pretty sensitive guy.
Arya: Oh, really?
Jaqen: Once when I was in Westeros, I saved the life of a wolf pup.
Arya: And why did you save it?
Jaqen: Because all I saw was this little fur ball that needed love.

dialogue.name: Jaqen
dialogue.label: Jaqen:
dialogue.phrase: That kind of hurts my feelings a little bit. I'm actually a pretty sensitive guy.

summary: Jonrya discord chat for Season 8
title: Jonrya discord chat for Season 8
body:
As we all know, GOT is finally returning next week 💖

For anyone who is interested, there is an existing Jonrya discord chat that is open to all Jonrya shippers.

Please feel free to message either myself or @aegon for an invite if you’d like to join!
